document.docTitle: Insight into tetrahydrofuran lignans from Isatis indigotica fortune with neuroprotective and acetylcholinesterase inhibitor activity

paragraph.docTitle:
Insight into tetrahydrofuran lignans from
Isatis indigotica fortune
with neuroprotective and acetylcholinesterase inhibitor activity

document.paragraph: A R T I C L E I N F O

subSection.paragraph: Tetrahydrofuran lignans

MAEΔΔ δ
parameter
Neuroprotective effects
Acetylcholinesterase inhibitory
A B S T R A C T

Nine tetrahydrofuran lignans, including three undescribed spiro-lignans, were isolated from
Isatis indigotica Fortune (Brassicaceae)
. Extensive spectroscopic analyses achieved the structure elucidation of these tetrahydrofuran lignans, and quantum chemical calculation combined with the
MAEΔΔ δ
parameter. Notably, isatispironeols A-B have a unique spiro[dienone-tetrahydrofuran] molecular core. These spiro[dienone-tetrahydrofuran] lignans showed comparable neuroprotective effects as the positive control in the H 2 O 2 -induced SH-SY5Y cells model. In addition, ()-(7 R, 8 S, 1 ′ R, 7 ′ R, 8 ′ R )-isatispironeol A possessed more significant AChE inhibitory activity, further interact sites were also predicted by the in silico assay.

Previous phytochemistry research on
I. indigotica
indicated this plant could produce lignans, alkaloids, and flavonoids ( Liu et al., 2017 ; Guo et al., 2020 ). Lignans, one of the most critical chemical ingredients from
I. indigotica
, possess various biological activities, i.e., neuroprotective, enzyme inhibition, and anti-AD activities ( Deng et al., 2021 ; Xi et al., 2019 ; Li et al., 2015 ). In order to seek bioactive lignans, nine tetrahydrofuran lignans including three undescribed ones ( 1a / 1b and 2 ) and two known analogues ( 3a / 3b ), along with four known bistetrahydrofuran lignans ( 4–7 ) were isolated from
I. indigotica .
Compounds 1a / 1b–3a/3b have a novel spiro[dienone-tetrahydrofuran] molecular core. Herein, the isolation, chiral resolution, structure analysis, as well as AChE inhibitory and neuroprotective activities were described.

Isatispironeol A ( 1 ), yellow oil, has a molecular formula of C 31 H 36 O 11 (14 degrees of unsaturation) by HRESIMS ([M + Na] + at m/z 607.2158, calcd for C 31 H 36 O 11 Na, 607.2150). Two typical ABX systems at δ H 7.07 (1H, d, J = 1.4 Hz, H-2), 6.76 (1H, overlapped, H-5), 6.88 (1H, overlapped, H-6), 6.87 (1H, overlapped, H-2 ′′ ), 6.77 (1H, overlapped, H-5 ′′ ), 6.72 (1H, d, J = 8.2 Hz, H-6 ′′ ), one trans -substituted olefinic bond at δ H 6.39 (1H, d, J = 15.9 Hz, H-7 ′′ ), 6.19 (1H, dt, J = 15.9, 5.3 Hz, H-8 ′′ ), two olefinic protons at δ H 6.14 (1H, s, H-2 ′ ), 6.11 (1H, s, H-6 ′ ), four methines at δ H 5.00 (1H, d, J = 9.5 Hz, H-7), 2.72 (1H, m, H-8), 4.67 (1H, overlapped, H-7 ′ ), 4.34 (1H, m, H-8 ′ ), three methylene groups at δ H 3.22 (1H, dd, J = 10.5, 5.2 Hz, H-9a), 3.16 (1H, dd, J = 10.5, 5.0 Hz, H-9b); 3.72 (1H, m, H-9 ′ a) and 3.57 (1H, m, H-9 ′ b) and 4.07 (2H, br s, H-9 ′′ ). In addition, four hydroxyl protons at δ H 8.91 (1H, br s, 4-OH), 4.37 (1H, t, J = 4.4 Hz, 9-OH), 4.67 (1H, overlapped, 9 ′ -OH), 4.78 (1H, t, J = 5.1 Hz, 9 ′′ -OH) as well as four methoxy groups at δ H 3.80 (3H, s, 3- OCH 3 ), 3.54 (3H, s, 3 ′ -OCH 3 ), 3.55 (3H, s, 5 ′ -OCH 3 ), 3.64 (3H, s, 3 ′′ - OCH 3 ) can be observed from the 1 H NMR spectrum of 1 . The 13 C NMR of 1 ( Table 1 ) displayed 31 carbon responses, with the aid of the HSQC experiment, these signals corresponding to twelve aromatic carbons ( δ C 148.9, 147.4, 146.4, 145.9, 133.6, 129.4, 119.0, 118.5, 115.1, 113.4, 110.7, 108.9), six olefinic carbons ( δ C 151.0, 150.4, 128.8, 128.1, 119.0 and 113.1), one carbonyl carbon ( δ C 175.4), three methylene carbons ( δ C 61.7, 60.8 and 58.1), four methine carbons ( δ C 83.8, 81.9, 78.3 and 59.8), four methoxy groups ( δ C 55.6, 55.0, 54.5 and 54.5) together with one sp 3 hybridized quaternary carbon ( δ C 51.9) (see Fig. 1 ).
* Corresponding author.

1 Yu-Fei Xi and Ming Bai made equal contributions to the article.

Furthermore, the HMBC cross-peaks ( Fig. 2 ) from H-2 ( δ H 7.07)/H-6 ( δ H 6.88) to C-7 ( δ C 81.9), H-7 ( δ H 5.00) to C-9 ( δ C 58.1), δ H 4.37 (9-OH) to C-8 ( δ C 59.8) plus H-9 ( δ H 3.22, 3.16) to C-1’ ( δ C 51.9) showed that compound 1 has a similar structure to tetrahydrofuran lignans and contains a fragment of benzotetrahydrofuran ring. In addition, the correlations of H-2’ ( δ H 6.14)/C-3’ ( δ C 151.0) and C-4’ ( δ C 175.4), H-6’ ( δ H 6.11)/C-4’ ( δ C 175.4), C-2’ ( δ C 113.1) and C-5’ ( δ C 150.4), H-8 ( δ H 2.72)/ C-2’ ( δ C 113.1) and C-6’ ( δ C 119.0) along with H-7’ ( δ H 4.67)/C-2’ ( δ C 113.1) and C-6’ ( δ C 119.0) indicated a fragment of dienone shared a common atom at C-1’ ( δ C 51.9) with the tetrahydrofuran moiety. The correlations of H-2’’ ( δ H 6.87)/C-4’’ ( δ C 146.4), C-6’’ ( δ C 118.5) and C-7’’ ( δ C 128.8), H-5’’ ( δ H 6.77)/C-1’’ ( δ C 129.4), H-7’’ ( δ H 6.39)/C-6’’ ( δ C 118.5) and C-9’’ ( δ C 61.7), H-8’’ ( δ H 6.19)/C-1’’ ( δ C 129.4) and δ H 4.78 (9 ′′ -OH)/C-9’’ ( δ C 61.7) demonstrated a caffeyl alcohol moiety. The correlations of H-8’ ( δ H 4.34)/C-7’ ( δ C 83.8), δ H 4.67 (9 ′ -OH)/C-8’ ( δ C 78.3), and C-9’ ( δ C 60.8) as well as the down-field chemical shift of C-4 ′′ finally established the gross structure of 1 .

The relative configurations of 1 can be deduced from the obvious NOE correlations and coupling constant. The NOE correlation of H-7’/H-8 suggested that these protons were placed on the same face of the tetrahydrofuran ring. H-7 was placed on the opposite orientation with H-8 for the cross-peak of H-7/H- 9 in the NOESY experiment. In addition, this assumption has been demonstrated by the large coupling constant of J H-7, H-8 = 9.5 Hz ( Lai et al., 2015 ; Sinkkonen et al., 2007 ; Yoshikawa et al., 1997 ). However, the relative configuration of C-8 ′ could not be determined by the lack of NOE correlation.

Isatispironeol B ( 2 ),[ α ]
D
106.7 ( c 0.10, MeOH), has the same elemental composition as 1 , according to the HRESIMS data analysis. The 1 H and 13 C NMR data of 2 closely resembled 1 ( Table 1 ), indicating they have similar scaffolds. The HMBC data of 2 ( Fig. 2 ) enabled the establishment of the same gross structure as 1 . The above information indicated that 2 was an epimer of 1 . The relative configurations of C-7, C-8, C-1 ′ , and C-7 ′ were determined to be the same as 1 based on the apparent cross-peaks of H-8/H-7 ′ , H-7/H-9, H-2’/H-8 ′ , H-2’/H-9 and H-6’/H- 8 in the NOESY experiment ( Fig. 3 ).

caption.paragraph: 1 H (400 MHz) and 13 C NMR (100 MHz) spectroscopic data of 1 and 2 in

subSection.paragraph: To determine the relative configuration of C-8 ′ for 1 and 2 , the theoretical calculations of NMR data for 7 S *,8 R *,7 ′ S *,8 ′ S * and 7 S *,8 R *,7 ′ S *,8 ′ R * were carried out. However, the R 2 and DP4+ probability analysis point to an ambiguous conclusion, which the structural similarity could contribute.

The
MAEΔΔ δ
is a valuable parameter, which can be successfully employed to make correct stereochemical assignments ( Tian et al., 2021 ). This method is based on the analyses of calculated and experimental NMR data to generate a final
MAEΔΔ δ
ranking. The lowest
MAEΔΔ δ
would give us a satisfactory relative configuration assignment ( Lauro et al., 2020 ).

Two possible structures were calculated as calcA and calcB, and then they were performed employing the
MAEΔΔ δ
parameter ( Fig. 4 ). The lower
MAEΔΔ δ
parameter means that the experimental data of 1 matched well with those of calculated data of calcA, which confirmed the relative configuration of 1 was 7 S *,8 R *,7 ′ S *,8 ′ R *. Correspondingly, the relative configuration of 2 was determined as 7 S *,8 R *,7 ′ S *,8 ′ S *.

Considering the specific rotation of 1 is approaching zero, therefore 1 should be a racemic mixture. Two enantiomers ( 1a and 1b ) were purified by the chiral resolution from 1 . Their absolute configurations were defined for the calculated and experimental ECD curves, respectively ( Fig. 5 ).

Two known spiro[dienone-tetrahydrofuran] lignan enantiomers ( 3a and 3b ) were also obtained and defined as (+)-(7 S ,8 R ,1 ′ S ,7 ′ S ,8 ′ R )- sibiricumin A and ()-(7 R ,8 S ,1 ′ R ,7 ′ R ,8 ′ S )-sibiricumin A ( Shi et al., 2014 ), respectively. Additionally, compounds 4–7 were identified as acanthoside B ( Lee et al., 2016 ), eucommin A ( Xue et al., 2020 ), pinoresinol 4- O -β -D-glucoside ( Jang et al., 2022 ), and lirioresinol A ( Ma et al., 2020 ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 1. Tetrahydrofuran type spiro-lignans isolated from the leaves of
I. indigotica
.
Fig. 2. Key HMBC correlations for compounds 1 and 2 .
Fig. 3. The key NOESY correlations of compounds 1 and 2 .

subSection.paragraph: In addition, AChE also plays a crucial factor during the development of AD ( Liu et al., 2021 ). Therefore, the inhibitory effects of these lignans on AChE were evaluated. The results are displayed in Table 2 . Compound 1b possessed more significant inhibitory activity with IC 50 as 0.67 μM than donepezil, and 6–7 have an approximately equal effect as donepezil.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4.
MAEΔΔ δ
parameters of 1 and 2 based on calculated and experimental NMR chemical shifts.
Fig. 5. Experimental and calculated ECD spectra for compounds 1a/1b and 2 in MeOH.

subSection.paragraph: To further investigate the interactions of compound 1b with AChE, a molecular docking was performed. The in silico results showed that the hydrogen bond interactions between 1b with Tyr 121 and Asn 289 ( Fig. 7 ), which suggested that Tyr 121 and Asn 289 could be key active residues.

In conclusion, nine tetrahydrofuran lignans, including three undescribed spiro-lignans ( 1a / 1b and 2 ) were isolated from
I. indigotica
. Extensive spectroscopic analyses achieved the structure elucidation of these tetrahydrofuran lignans, quantum chemical calculation combined with DP4+ probability analysis, and
MAEΔΔ δ
parameter. Notably, compounds 1a / 1b , 2 , and 3a/3b have a unique spiro[dienone-tetrahydrofuran] molecular core. These spiro-lignans ( 1a / 1b , 2 , 3a/ 3b ) showed comparable neuroprotective effects as the positive control. In addition, compound 1b possessed greater AChE inhibitory activity, further interact sites were also predicted by the in silico assay. This study provided new insight into the development and utilization of
I. indigotica
in anti-AD medicinal products.

caption.paragraph: Fig. 6. The neuroprotective effects of compounds 1a/1b -7 against H 2 O 2 -induced injury in SH-SY5Y cells. After H 2 O 2 (200 μM) treatment, cell viabilities were determined by MTT assay in the presence or absence of the tested compounds at different concentrations (12.5, 25, 50 μM).
Inhibitory effects of compounds on AChE (IC 50 , μ M).

subSection.paragraph: HRESIMS were acquired on a Bruker Micro Q-TOF instrument (Bruker Co., Karlsruhe, Germany ) in positive-ion mode. Bruker ARX-400 and AVIII-600 spectrometers (Bruker Corporation, Bremen , Germany ) were used to record the NMR spectra. JASCO DIP-370 digital polarimeter (Jasco, Tokyo , Japan ) was used to measure the optical rotation values. UV spectra were performed on a Shimadzu UV-1700 spectrometer (Shimadzu, Tokyo , Japan ). Bio-Logic MOS 450 detector (Bio-Logic Science Instruments, Seyssinet Pariset, France ) was used to conduct ECD spectra. Semi-preparative HPLC was performed on a Shimadzu LC-6AD pump system with a Shimadzu SPD-20A detector, using a YMC C 18 column (250 × 10 mm , 5 μm, Shimadzu, Tokyo , Japan ). The Daicel Chiralpak AD-H column ( 250 mm × 4.6 mm , 5 μm, Daicel Polymer Ltd., Tokyo , Japan ) was used in the chiral-phase HPLC system with hexaneisopropanol. The organic solvents were distilled before the separation process. Column chromatography was carried out on Dianion HP-20 macroporous resin, silica gel (100–200 or 200–300 mesh, Qingdao Marine Chemical Inc., Shangdong, China ), polyamide column (60–90 mesh, Chemical Inc., China ), ODS gel (60–80 μm, Merck, Frankfurter, Germany ). All the chromatographic and analytical grade reagents were obtained from Shandong Yuwang Chemical Company (Shangdong, China ). MTT assays were performed on a Varioskan Flash Multimode Reader (Thermo Scientific Co. Ltd, Waltham, MA, USA ).

caption.paragraph: Fig. 7. Molecular docking of 1b within AChE (PDB ID:1EVE) binding pocket.

subSection.paragraph:
Material from the leaves of
Isatis indigotica Fortune (Brassicaceae)
(http://www.worldfloraonline.org/taxon/wfo-0000732392), was collected in
June 2015
from Bozhou (
115 ◦ 78 ′ E
,
33 ◦ 85 ′ N
) in Anhui Province of China . These plant materials were authenticated by Professor Lu Jincai from SPU . A voucher specimen (specimen ID is 20160707 ) is deposited at the herbarium of SPU
.

The dried leaves of
I. indigotica
( 50 kg ) were soaked overnight at room temperature and then extracted two times with 80% EtOH to yield a crude residue ( 4.28 kg ). The concentrated extracts were extracted with CH 2 Cl 2 and n -BuOH. After multiple column chromatographies, three independent fractions (Fr. A1-Fr. A3) were obtained from the CH 2 Cl 2 extract ( 864.6 g ). With the help of preparative and semi-preparative HPLC, compounds 1 ( 7.5 mg , t R = 14.7 min), 2 ( 5.7 mg , t R = 18.9 min), 3 ( 9.7 mg , t R = 21.3 min), 4 ( 23.1 mg , t R = 20.4 min), 5 ( 17.9 mg , t R = 15.8 min), 6 ( 4.1 mg , t R = 19.7 min), and 7 ( 33.7 mg , t R = 26.8 min) were isolated from Fr. A2. The enantiomers were performed by chiral resolutions to purified 1a ( 2.4 mg , t R = 32.3 min), 1b ( 4.9 mg , t R = 49.5 min), 3a (3.0 mg, t R = 20.5 min), and 3b ( 6.5 mg , t R = 30.7 min), respectively.

Isatispironeol B ( 2 ): Yellow oil.[ α ]
D
20 106.7 ( c 0.1, MeOH); UV (MeOH) λ max (log ε ) 203.0 (3.91), 271.0 (3.32) nm; ECD (MeOH) λ max (Δ ε ) 209 (6.74), 259 (+ 5.26) nm; 1 H and 13 C NMR data see Table 1 ; HRESIMS: m / z 607.2167 [M + Na] + , (calcd for C 31 H 36 O 11 Na, 607.2150).

The H 2 O 2 -induced SH-SY5Y cells model was selected for evaluating the neuroprotective activity of these compounds. SH-SY5Y cells were pretreated with various concentrations (12.5, 25 and 50 μM) of tested samples for 1 h before H 2 O 2 (200 μM) treatment for another 4 h. Then, 20 μL MTT was added to each well at 37 ◦ C for 4 h, and the resultant crystals were dissolved in DMSO. The absorbance was measured at 490 nm . Cell viability was expressed as a percentage relative to the value of the control group ( Li et al., 2022 ; Zhang et al., 2022 ).

The inhibitory assay was operated following the reported description. Compounds 1–7 were dissolved in DMSO. The mixture contained 50 μL phosphate buffer (pH 7.5), 25 μL of compound at 12.5, 25 and 50 μM, 125 μL of DTNB (0.5 mM) and 12.5 μL AChE (0.1 U/mL), and refrigerated the mixture overnight. The reaction was initiated by the addition of 50 μL of ACTI (0.15 mM). The hydrolysis of ATCI was monitored at 412 nm after 5 min. Donepezil was used as positive control ( Peng et al., 2021 ; Yu et al., 2022 ; Zhan et al., 2023 ).

The crystal structures of AChE (PDB ID: 1EVE) with 2.50 Å resolution were selected as the receptor. The lowest energy conformation of 1b was established by Spartan with an MMFF94 force field. Schrodinger Maestro program performed the molecular docking between AChE and 1b , and the results could be visualized by PyMOL ( Bai et al., 2022 ; Liu et al., 2022b ).
The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.
Data will be made available on request.
